discussion.content:
C is correct
"Call signaling from Webex Calling (SIP TLS) to Local Gateway" uses "8934 TCP"
https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/b2exve/Port-Reference-Information-for-Webex-Calling

choices.A: Open UDP port 5062 outbound on the firewall.
choices.B: Open TCP port 5062 outbound on the firewall.
choices.D: Open UDP port 8934 outbound on the firewall.
choices.C: Open TCP port 8934 outbound on the firewall.

choices.D: Add the regional manager's extension as an alternate extension for all system users.
choices.C: Add the regional manager user to the undeliverable messages distribution list.
choices.B: Add a wild-card alternate extension to the regional manager user.
choices.A: Add the regional manager user to the all voicemail users distribution list.

questions.question_text: An administrator must ensure that voice messages intended for mailboxes that cannot be located are forwarded to the regional manager's mailbox. Which configuration accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
"if Unity Connection cannot deliver the message because of issues that are not likely to be resolved (for example, the caller was disconnected before addressing the message or the recipient mailbox has been deleted), the message is sent to the Undeliverable Messages distribution list"
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/connection/11x/troubleshooting/guide/b_11xcuctsg/b_11xcuctsg_chapter_01010.html#:~:text=In%20general%2C%20if%20Unity%20Connection,distribution%20list%2C%20and%20Unity%20Connection

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

upon further research: C is correct
see Fig 1 Step 2 - Upon receipt of the request from the browser, the service provider generates a SAML authentication request.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/SAML_SSO_deployment_guide/12_5_1/cucm_b_saml-sso-deployment-guide-12_5/cucm_b_saml-sso-deployment-guide-12_5_chapter_01.html

A browser-based client attempts to access a protected resource on a service provider.
 
The browser does not have an existing session with the service provider.
Upon receipt of the request from the browser, the service provider generates a SAML authentication request.

choices.C: The service provider generates a SAML authentication request.
choices.A: The browser follows the redirect and issues an HTTPS GET request to the IdP.
choices.D: The SAML request is maintained as a query parameter in the GET request.
choices.B: The IdP checks for a valid browser session.

questions.question_text: SAML SSO is enabled in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. What happens when a browser-based client attempts to access a protected resource on a service provider?

choices.C: Help, Health Checker, and press Diagnostics in the Webex App or Ctrl+Shift+Alt+D
choices.A: Settings, Status, and press Diagnostics in the Webex App or Ctrl+Shift+Alt+S
choices.B: Settings, Health Checker, and press Diagnostics in the Webex App or Ctrl+Shift+Alt+D
choices.D: Help, Health Checker, and press Status in the Webex App or Ctrl+Shift+Alt+S

questions.question_text: A user is experiencing video quality issues and wants to verify packet loss, jitter, and codecs in use. Where can the user find this information in the Webex App for Windows during a call?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
None of these is entirely correct

The Keyboard Shortcut for Diagnostics is Ctrl+Shift+Alt+D
https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/7wr87q/Webex-App-%7C-Keyboard-navigation-and-shortcuts#reference-template_a0ac691e-a653-4152-9a20-60c8627bd454

Neither "Help" nor "Settings" in the App gives an Option to open the Health Checker

You can open the Diagnostics by clicking your "Profile Icon > Help > Health Checker > Diagnostics"
And in the Call Window under "More Options (3 Dots/ Hamburger menu) > Statistics"

I guess they are expecting Answer C - but it's technically not correct

Selected Answer: D
Fairly certain D is correct

choices.A: Add the host “imp-pub” to the proxy exceptions list on the users’ Windows computers.
choices.C: Restart the IM and Presence services on the host “imp-pub”.
choices.D: Change the DNS SRV record to point to the Cisco UCM node instead of the IM and Presence node.
